item.title: Report E-2025040278
item.description:
Report E-2025040278

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:43 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UFV) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, an approximately 1 cup of Bowl Guard (Hazardous - UN1789) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the box containers. The caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product and damaged bottles of waste product with boxes were placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Larry (Infotrac) who provided report #384-445.

item.title: Report E-2025040270
item.description:
Report E-2025040270

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:01 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal UFV. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of Star Nails Cool Mint Gel Set released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to damage received during dock operations. The release impacted dock #21. Terminal personnel had cleaned and containerized the spilled product, placing it within a 65-gallon poly drum. Waste label 230170-1 was created, one 65-gallon poly drum containing the 55-gallon metal drum. CHEMTREC was notified of the spill, report #2025031100148.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 9, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, hand tools, and cleaning agents to remediate the impacted locations. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040112
item.description:
Report E-2025040112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-06
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area and 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt and a 10ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor. They estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released most likely due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel inspected all 24 drums on the trailer and found only one (1) drum was affected. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum was contained in one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. Contractor personnel deployed granular absorbents to the affected areas and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2025, ten (10) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 12:17 ON 3/22/2025 RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL, SAYING WAS NEEDED AT DOOR 64 ASAP. RESPONDER WENT OVER TO DOOR 64 WHERE A SUPERVISOR WAS PULLING A PACKAGE DOWN FORM THE GRATING AND PLACING IT ON A PALLET. ANOTHER EXPLAINED THAT WHILE A LOADER WAS PULLING THE PACKAGE OFF THE EXTEND IT STARTED TO SPARK FROM THE INSIDE. WHEN THIS HAPPENED, SHE DROPPED THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR, AND IT IMMEDIATELY CAUGHT FIRE ON ONE END. ONE END OF THE BOX WAS OPEN, AND RESPONDER COULD SEE SCORCH MARKS ON THE DEVICE INSIDE AND THE INSIDE FLAPS OF THE PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM BATTERY WAS BEING SHIPPED GROUND SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 16A732, ENERZ-Z, 3984 EMERALD DOWNS DR, YORBA LINDA CA 92886.

item.title: Report E-2025040109
item.description:
Report E-2025040109

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: VALLEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that there were seven trooper vehicles, 4 fire trucks, and CEMA personnel onsite assisting with cleanup, too. The released material impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of the highway. Clean Harbors personnel transferred an estimated two hundred and twenty-five (225) gallons of material to a new tote using an onsite gravity transfer. The damaged and new totes were offloaded from the trailer. The contractor estimated fifty (50) gallons of Ethanol was released from the tote. There were no areas to clean in the trailer because the Ethanol had evaporated. A hazmat driver from Clean Harbors arrived to assist with taking the trailer, both totes, and waste to the West Sacramento ESTES terminal. The empty tote and the tote of product were labeled and staged in the center of the dock near 136 door. The waste generated will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal. It is recommended the asphalt at the site of the release should be pressure washed.
